titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hank Miller Papers WAG.176
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Maggie Schreiner

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-03T12:47-0500

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.physloc: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu prior to research visit.
did.abstract: Hank Miller was the General President of Local 424, an independent union of trucker drivers. This collection contains materials related to Local 424.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Hank Miller Papers; WAG 176; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Hank Miller in 2002. The accession number 2002.027 is associated with this gift. Additional materials were donated later in 2002.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Hank Miller, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2002. Permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to Local 424, an independent union of trucker drivers.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hank Miller was the General President of Local 424, an independent union of trucker drivers. Local 424 was previously affiliated with the Teamsters.

controlaccess.subject: Truck drivers |x Labor unions |z United States.
